page.title: 16FISHING INDUSTRY IN HULL
page.content: The first mention of Fishiing in Hull in historical documents is 1160 when Monks of the Meaux Abbey were given the 'Cain Charter' to fish the Humber. Since then though there have been many changes and Hull grew to be the major Fish Port in Europe. Then came one of the most dramatic declines in Hulls history. Hull now has just 2 deep sea trawlers, 7 years ago there were 70. Why? Common Market quotas were to low and costs rose at the same time there was an extension of fishing limits to 200 miles which cut Hulls fleet off from its traditional grounds. All is not lost though as the fish market still flourishes and the fish processing industry is still strong. Last year firms such as Birds Eye, Ross Foods,Marr's and Smales used 50,000 tonnes of fish and Icelandic boats landed fish worth Â£4m in Hull.
